description_en: Age in years.
Pulse in beats per minute.
Systolic blood pressure in mm Hg.
Diastolic blood pressure in mm Hg.
Cholesterol in mmol/L.
Height in m.
Weight in kg.

Has a family history of heart disease (heart attack, angina, or had a heart bypass operation) within the immediate family (brother, sister, father or mother, blood relatives only)? Note that D means: do not know.
If the family has a history of heart disease, how old was the family member when it happened (if more than one family member, give the age of the youngest person)?
Has a family history of cancer within the immediate family (blood relatives only)? Note that D means: do not know.
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had a heart attack (coronary)?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had a stroke?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had diabetes?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had high blood pressure (hypertension)?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had high cholesterol?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had asthma?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have had cancer?
Have you ever received treatment from a doctor for acne (pimples)?
Have you ever received treatment from a doctor for sunburn?
Have you ever smoked tailor-made or roll-you-own cigarettes once a week or more?
Do you smoke tailor-made or roll-you-own cigarettes now?
If you don't smoke now, how old were you when you stopped smoking?
If you smoke now, for how many years altogether have you smoked tailor-made or roll-you-own cigarettes?
Do you drink alcohol once a month or more?
About how often do you drink alcohol (days per week)?
How many drinks per week, on average.
In the last three months, what is the largest number of drinks that you had on any one day?
Does your mood often go up or down?
Do you ever feel just miserable for no reason?
Are your feelings easily hurt?
Do you often feel fed up?
Would you call yourself a nervous person?
Are you a worrier?
Do you worry about awful things that might happen?
Would you call yourself tense or highly strung?
Do you worry too long after an embarrassing experience?
Do you suffer from nerves?
Do you have a friend or family member that you can talk to about problems or worries that you may have? Note: The value TRUE means no.
In your lifetime, have you ever had two weeks or more when nearly every day you felt sad or depressed?
How many hours per week would you do any vigorous activity or exercise either at work or away from work that makes you breathe hard and sweat?
How many hours per week would you do any moderate activity or exercise such as brisk walking, cycling or mowing the lawn?
On an average work day, how long would you spend on your feet, either standing or moving about?
What ethnic group do you belong to? European = European (NZ European or British or other European), Maori = Maori, Polynesian = Pacific Island Polynesian, Other = Other (Chinese, Indian, Other).
How many hours do you usually sleep each night?
Do you usually snore? Note that D means: do not know.
Do you have a household pet cat?
Do you have a household pet dog?
Are you right-handed, left-handed, or no preference for left or right?
How many people (including yourself) usually live in your house?
single = single, married = married or living with a partner, separated = separated or divorced, widowed = widowed.
What was the highest level of education you received? primary = Primary school, secondary = High school/secondary school, polytechnic = Polytechnic or similar, university = University.
